Googled this problem. Most people said it's because of =
conflicts of certificates or signed and unsigned class in classpath. But I =
only have two jars in my classpath, one is my signed jar, the other is juni=
t jar.  I don't see conflicts here and I can guarantee that all classes in =
the jar are signed with the same certificate.

Actually my NetBeans project=
 which includes the same jar, JUnit4 and many JUnit test cases works just f=
ine. I just cannot make this java command line working.

Anybody can help w=
ith it?

Thanks in advance.
